explanation: [0-0] In the shot, a man sits on a pink chair on a beach, holding a book. Next to the chair is a pile of small stones. Not far away, there is a grove of trees.
[0-2] First, he puts down the book and picks up a small stone. With his eyes closed and brows furrowed, he throws it backward forcefully.
[0-2] First, he puts down the book and picks up a small stone. With his eyes closed and brows furrowed, he throws it backward forcefully.

[2-4] Next, the camera pans right to reveal a red chair on the sand under the trees. Next to it is a bridge made of several wooden sticks. The stone hits a coconut in the tree, and a coconut falls from the tree, landing on the wood next to the chair.

[2-4] Next, the camera pans right to reveal a red chair on the sand under the trees. Next to it is a bridge made of several wooden sticks. The stone hits a coconut in the tree, and a coconut falls from the tree, landing on the wood next to the chair.

[4-10] Then, the coconut rolls leftward on the wood, reaching the other end of the wood, and knocks off a supporting stick next to it. Suddenly, a piece of wood connected to a knife above falls and pierces the coconut. The tail end of the wood is connected to a green kettle. An orange cup is placed below the kettle.
